cyclone.name: FLORENCE
cyclone.current_location: about 100 miles ESE of Wilmington, North Carolina
cyclone.trajectory: Slowly drifting west-northwest tonight, then west to west-southwest across southern North Carolina and northeastern South Carolina Friday–Saturday, turning northward inland toward the Ohio Valley early next week.

weather_observation.watch_coast: Edisto Beach SC to South Santee River SC under Hurricane Watch; additional Storm-Surge Watch from Edisto Beach SC to South Santee River SC and north of Duck NC to NC/VA border
weather_observation.warning_coast: Hurricane Warning from South Santee River SC to Duck NC including Albemarle and Pamlico Sounds; Storm Surge Warning South Santee River SC to Duck NC including Neuse and Pamlico Rivers
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Coastal southeastern North Carolina and northeastern South Carolina, with effects spreading slowly inland across the Carolinas
weather_observation.rain_fall_above_4_inch: Unlikely (expected totals generally under 2 inches in SE Michigan)
weather_observation.wind: Occasional gusty winds possible (20–30 mph) as remnants pass south of Michigan early next week
weather_observation.rainfall: Periods of moderate rain Monday–Tuesday could total 1–2 inches
weather_observation.other_hazards: Possible localized river/stream rises but widespread flooding not expected
